title: Chat session request handler differences with chat participant handler

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Issue identified by VS Code Team member as probable bug

body:
There's some code to deserialize progressTask here: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/7570f93dd86f418168789d34434a8ab60cf3a972/src/vs/workbench/api/browser/mainThreadChatAgents2.ts#L260-L267

but mainThreadChatSessions doesn't do the same thing

```
2025-08-23 16:01:28.797 [error] [Window] progress.onDidAddProgress is not a function: TypeError: progress.onDidAddProgress is not a function
    at Response.updateContent (vscode-file://vscode-app/Users/roblou/code/vscode/out/vs/workbench/contrib/chat/common/chatModel.js:364:35)
    at ChatResponseModel.updateContent (vscode-file://vscode-app/Users/roblou/code/vscode/out/vs/workbench/contrib/chat/common/chatModel.js:538:24)
    at ChatModel.acceptResponseProgress (vscode-file://vscode-app/Users/roblou/code/vscode/out/vs/workbench/contrib/chat/common/chatModel.js:1043:30)
    at progressCallback (vscode-file://vscode-app/Users/roblou/code/vscode/out/vs/workbench/contrib/chat/common/chatServiceImpl.js:755:27)
```

This code is kind of complicated, the types are not quite right, we need a better pattern for deserializing the dto data types into real objects.

It's not really a problem that I can't use `progressTask` specifically but I think the code for the chat session request handler stream is basically doing the same thing as for chat participants, so should it be more aligned?

title: Surface the vscode://schemas/color-theme schema to allow for programmatic use
body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->

Either in the repository or from the [Theme Color](https://code.visualstudio.com/api/references/theme-color) page, providing the schema will allow theme engine developers access to linting, information, in particular to CLI tools where they may not be in a VS Code environment, such as a CI/CD.

After creation of a theme, such tools would be able to validate against the schema, surfacing warnings and errors about the resulting JSON data, such as:

- invalid property names
- missing property names
- incorrect values; ex: some values need to have transparency
- etc

These are all visible within the UI when viewing and interacting with a theme's JSON, and is fantastic in that context, however, in a non-graphical context, developers need access to the schema to perform any number of validations to ensure correctitude and behavioural consistency.

title: Caret jumps to column 0 when clicking between first two characters

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Issue identified by VS Code Team member as probable bug

labels.name: verified
labels.description: Verification succeeded

labels.name: editor-input
labels.description: Editor text input

labels.name: regression
labels.description: Something that used to work is now broken

body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- 🕮 Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->
<!-- 🔎 Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- 🧪 Test using the latest Insiders build to see if your issue has already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->
<!-- 💡 Instead of creating your report here, use 'Report Issue' from the 'Help' menu in VS Code to pre-fill useful information. -->
<!-- 🔧 Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->

Clicking between the first and second characters in a line places the caret at column 0 instead of between the characters. Please see the screencast.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ade140c6-8b40-4d1d-afda-8ff57dd3838d

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a new file and type: `let x`
2. Click between `l` and `e` in `let`
3. Observe the caret position

Expected:
Caret is placed between `l` and `e` (column 1).

Actual:
Caret is placed before `l` (column 0).

Notes:

- Only the first column is affected. Other positions (e.g., between `e` and `t`) work correctly.
- Reproduces in both **Stable** and the latest **Insiders** version, checked with a clean installation / logged-out.
- The screencast uses increased UI scale for visibility, but the issue also occurs with the default VSCode and Windows display scaling.

Since I often have quite a few tabs open in a project, I'd like the tab part of the workspace to take up less space, to make room for coding and the terminal.

title: MCP Close transport message

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Issue identified by VS Code Team member as probable bug

body:
As described in MCP transport specification:
https://modelcontextprotocol.io/specification/2025-06-18/basic/transports

```
Clients that no longer need a particular session (e.g., because the user is leaving the client application) SHOULD send an HTTP DELETE to the MCP endpoint with the Mcp-Session-Id header, to explicitly terminate the session.
The server MAY respond to this request with HTTP 405 Method Not Allowed, indicating that the server does not allow clients to terminate sessions.
```

I created an HTTP MCP server and i am not seeing that VSCode is sending "DELETE" request to the server, was it implemented and the issue on my end or it wasn't implemented?

Copilot Chat Extension Version: Latest
VS Code Version: 1.104.0-insider
OS Version: windows11
Feature (e.g. agent/edit/ask mode): Agent
Selected model (e.g. GPT 4.1, Claude 3.7 Sonnet): Sonnet 4
Logs:
Steps to Reproduce:

Every time I send a message, the model gives one proper response and that's it.
If I try to continue the conversation, after sending a second message it won't respond anymore—it will remain stuck indefinitely at "Working".

I have to restart VSCode EVERY TIME just to get ONE single response, then repeat the process.

Even worse, sometimes it gets stuck after receiving some text, which not only leaves me without the completed message.

That has nothing to do with #252230. (Let's see if the bot stops acting up)

title: Improve "Open Recent" → "More..." Dialog: Show File/Folder Name First or Allow Resizing

labels.name: feature-request
labels.description: Request for new features or functionality

labels.name: quick-pick
labels.description: Quick-pick widget issues

labels.name: workbench-history
labels.description: History item issues

milestone.title: Backlog Candidates
milestone.description: Work that is not yet accepted for the Backlog. We wait for the community to weigh in.

body: When using File → Open Recent → More... in Visual Studio Code, the dialog displays the full path for each recent file or workspace. On Windows, long paths make it difficult to see the actual file or folder names, especially since the dialog cannot be resized. This makes it hard to quickly identify and select the desired item, reducing the usefulness of the "More..." feature. Suggested improvements: - Allow resizing the "More..." dialog window. - Optionally display the filename or folder name first, or highlight it, instead of showing the full path from the left. - Provide a tooltip or hover-over to show the full path if it is truncated. - Allow customizing the columns or view mode for recent items. **Benefit**: This would make it much easier to find and open recent files or folders, especially for users working with deep or lengthy directory structures.

title: The model gets stuck on EVERY message.
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates -->
<!-- Please attach logs to help us diagnose your issue -->

- Copilot Chat Extension Version: Latest
- VS Code Version: 1.104.0-insider
- OS Version: windows11
- Feature (e.g. agent/edit/ask mode): Agent
- Selected model (e.g. GPT 4.1, Claude 3.7 Sonnet): Sonnet 4
- Logs:

Steps to Reproduce:

Every time I send a message, the model gives one proper response and that's it.
If I try to continue the conversation, after sending a second message it won't respond anymore—it will remain stuck indefinitely at "Working".

I have to restart VSCode EVERY TIME just to get ONE single response, then repeat the process.

Even worse, sometimes it gets stuck after receiving some text, which not only leaves me without the completed message, but they still charge me for it as a premium request.

labels.name: markdown
labels.description: Markdown support issues

labels.name: *as-designed
labels.description: Described behavior is as designed

body: Hi, Currently, VS Code automatically adds a `border-bottom` property to all `h1` headers during preview, which breaks the user-defined formatting, causing the content not to display exactly as it's written in the code. As a result, when viewing documents with `---` (lines) under headings, two lines are shown, which is inconvenient. This behavior disrupts the way of working with Markdown because it introduces unusual and unexpected behavior, hindering the **real preview** of the document (It will not be displayed the same way in other places). Thank you very much!

title: BYOK ApplyPatch Support: Enable model family gating for GPT-5 and custom endpoints

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Issue identified by VS Code Team member as probable bug

body:
## Feature Request: BYOK ApplyPatch Support

### Problem
Currently, BYOK (Bring Your Own Key) models in VS Code Copilot Chat cannot enable the ApplyPatch tool unless the model family is explicitly set to "gpt-4.1", "o4-mini", or starts with "gpt-5". However, for BYOK providers, the `capabilities.family` field is hard-wired to the provider's internal name (e.g., "OpenAI", "Anthropic", etc.), not to these required gate values. There is no user-facing configuration to set `providerName` (and thus `capabilities.family`) to a custom value.

### Findings
- The extension code gates ApplyPatch solely on the value of `model.family`.
- For BYOK, `model.family` is always set to the provider's name (e.g., "OpenAI") unless the provider implementation itself is modified.
- There is no supported config or UI to override `providerName` so that BYOK models can opt into ApplyPatch by setting `family` to "gpt-5" or similar.
- As a result, users cannot enable ApplyPatch for BYOK models without modifying provider code or using a custom endpoint registration.

### Proposal
1. **Allow BYOK model config to specify `family`**: Permit users to set the `family` field per model in the Manage Models UI or config, overriding the provider default.
2. **Document gating logic**: Make it clear in documentation that ApplyPatch support is gated solely by `family` value.
3. **Consider fallback or aliasing logic**: Optionally, allow an alias or mapping so provider names like "OpenAI" can be mapped to supported families like "gpt-5" for ApplyPatch gating, without needing provider code changes.

### Impact
- Enables advanced users to take full advantage of Copilot Chat tools with BYOK models.
- Reduces friction for users who want to use newly released models for editing workflows.

---
References:
- [src/platform/endpoint/common/chatModelCapabilities.ts#L61-L88](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-copilot-chat/blob/main/src/platform/endpoint/common/chatModelCapabilities.ts)
- [src/extension/byok/common/byokProvider.ts#L117-L152](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-copilot-chat/blob/main/src/extension/byok/common/byokProvider.ts)

 ?? Hi can you set Log Level Trace in your settings, when you see this again, can you paste here the logs. As well as this, could you paste here your settings and extension list?

--> I will share my Log Trace here when it happens again ...


??  Do you see the error Contributed command editor.action.clipboardCopyAction does not exist in a notification when this happens?
--> No, no notifications appear when Copy Paste action is not working.

??  Do you see this happen in all editors, or maybe for example just in Jupyter notebooks?
--> I only experienced it in Vscode, and my colleague  in Visual Studio editor as well.

-?? Can you share your settings?

--> My default settings json:  [defaultSettings.json](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/21948014/defaultSettings.json)
--> My .vscode folder settings and extensions jsons: 
[settings.json](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/21948028/settings.json)
[extensions.json](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/21948029/extensions.json)

-?? Can you disable the setting editor.editContext and let me know if you continue seeing this?
--> I will do as you say and comment here the result; **please leave this issue opened** until this bug is fixed!!! This bug is really annoying and important, should be the first priority I guess!!

title: quick suggestions are indented on accept within switch statements with curly braces (duplicate of stale issue)
body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- 🕮 Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->
<!-- 🔎 Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- 🧪 Test using the latest Insiders build to see if your issue has already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->
<!-- 💡 Instead of creating your report here, use 'Report Issue' from the 'Help' menu in VS Code to pre-fill useful information. -->
<!-- 🔧 Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
- VS Code Version: 1.103.1
- OS Version:
NAME="Pop!_OS"
VERSION="22.04 LTS"


Steps to Reproduce:

When coding C# if I start with:

```
switch (command)
{
	case "cd":
	{
		var word = "test";
		break;
	}
}
```

and then highlight var and accept the quick suggestion to either fix formatting or replace var with an explicit type, then I end up with

```
switch (command)
{
	case "cd":
	{
			string word = "test";
		break;
	}
}
```

this behaviour is independent of the auto indent setting.

however, if we dont use the curly braces and use

```
switch (command)
{
	case "cd":
		var word = "test";
		break;
}
```
then the quick suggestions format things correctly. Its as if vscode is counting both the case: and { and indenting things twice (which then means the indentation is not preserved)

Using curly braces within switch cases is valid syntax and has valid uses, so it would be nice if this was fixed.

Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
- VS Code Version: 1.102.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu 22.04

Version: 1.102.1
Commit: 7adae6a56e34cb64d08899664b814cf620465925
Date: 2025-07-15T16:41:17.147Z
Electron: 35.6.0
ElectronBuildId: 11847422
Chromium: 134.0.6998.205
Node.js: 22.15.1
V8: 13.4.114.21-electron.0
OS: Linux x64 6.8.0-65-generic

## Steps to Reproduce:

1. add a debug task in `launch.json` (any program would work).
2. associate a `preLaunchTask` to the task (like removing some output file)
3. start the program by clicking the `|>` (start debugging, <key>F5</key>) button 
5. without ending the debug session, click start the program again.
6. when asked `'some task' is already running. Do you want to start another instance?`
7. click `Cancel` (not to start another instance).
8. sadly find out that `preLaunchTask` was already run, before the confirmation in step 6.

## Expected behavior:

8. the cancel button in step 7. blocks the execution of `preLaunchTask`. This is important, since `preLaunchTask` may clean the files used by the program under current debug session.

## Even Better:

8. in the dialog mentioned in step 6., provide the following options:
  a. (Cancel) do nothing.
  b. (Run preLaunchTask) just run `preLaunchTask`, without starting a debug session.
  c. (Continue without preLaunchTask) debug the program without running `preLaunchTask`.
  d. (Yes) start debugging, with `preLaunchTask` executed.

title: Copilot needs to learn to run background processes by default

labels.name: *duplicate
labels.description: Issue identified as a duplicate of another issue(s)

body: - Copilot Chat Extension Version: 0.31.2025082101 - VS Code Version: 1.104-0insider - OS Version: Windows 11 - Feature (e.g. agent/edit/ask mode): agent - Selected model (e.g. GPT 4.1, Claude 3.7 Sonnet): Claude 4 Sonnet - Logs: ### Steps to Reproduce: This is not my exact step, but I think this will reproduce it. **Tell the agent to start the reactjs app and then run the tests.** ### Result See result, the agent will run `npm run dev` in a terminal, which is a foreground process. And then it will run `npm test` **in the same terminal** ### Workaround I will have to actively press CTRL+C so the copilot agent will resume again. However the agent will think that the process failed and will try a different command, which is annoying because it got the command right the first time, it just failed to run it in the correct terminal. ### Proposed solution Here are some options: 1. Copilot agent almost always run things as a background process (unless it makes sense for it to run as a foreground process). 2. Copilot to know when to launch a new terminal (when there is an active foreground process) Bonus: I also find it annoying that it will keep running `npm run dev` at multiple points, when it already did so previously. It should recognize that the app is already running before attempting to run it again.

title: Copilot Chat error “Illegal state: service accessor is only valid during the invocation of its target method” when chat.edits2.enabled = true and sending a prompt

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Issue identified by VS Code Team member as probable bug

labels.name: verified
labels.description: Verification succeeded

body:
Type: Bug ### Bug type Copilot Chat error when sending a prompt with `chat.edits2.enabled = true` ### Environment - VS Code Insiders: `1.104.0-insider` (`df6568066e88d67331cec7a12a34bdef058fb62b`) — built 2025‑08‑22 - OS: macOS `Darwin arm64 24.6.0` - Electron: `37.2.3` - Chromium: `138.0.7204.100` - Node.js: `22.17.0` - V8: `13.8.500258-electron.0` Extensions (minimal to repro) - GitHub Copilot: `1.360.1752` - GitHub Copilot Chat: `0.31.2025082213` ### Minimal settings to reproduce ```json { "editor.inlineSuggest.enabled": true, "github.copilot.enable": { "*": true }, "chat.edits2.enabled": true } ``` ### Steps to reproduce 1. Start VS Code Insiders. 2. Open the Copilot Chat view. 3. Send any prompt. ### Expected Prompt is processed and a response is returned. ### Actual An error appears: ``` Illegal state: service accessor is only valid during the invocation of its target method ``` Notes: - Copilot inline suggestions and the inline “Fix” command continue to work. - The issue triggers specifically when sending a prompt in the Copilot Chat UI. ### Repro scope - Reproduces in a clean Temporary Profile with only Copilot and Copilot Chat installed, after setting `"chat.edits2.enabled": true`. - Disabling the flag (`"chat.edits2.enabled": false`) immediately stops the issue. - Extension Bisect did not identify another conflicting extension. ### Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled? N/A — the feature under test (Copilot Chat) requires the Copilot extensions to be enabled. Per the VS Code guidance, this has been minimized to only the required extensions and also reproduced in a Temporary Profile. ### Workaround Set: ```json "chat.edits2.enabled": false ``` Then “Developer: Reload Window”. ### Additional context - I can reproduce consistently by toggling only the single setting above. - Not yet tested on VS Code Stable. ### Reporting notes (per guidelines) - Includes exact VS Code/OS versions, installed extensions, minimal steps, and minimal settings that reproduce. Thank you! title: Improve window.showTextDocument API when called with no/default options

labels.name: feature-request
labels.description: Request for new features or functionality

labels.name: workbench-editors
labels.description: Managing of editor widgets in workbench window

milestone.title: Backlog Candidates
milestone.description: Work that is not yet accepted for the Backlog. We wait for the community to weigh in.

body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

While using the `ms-vscode.cpptools` extension, I frequently edit classes in a split-screen view, with the *.cpp file open on the left and the *.h file open on the right. If I add a function definition to my *.h file and select the "Create definition in *.cpp file" option, it opens the *.cpp file in a new tab in the right-hand tab group, rather than switching focus to the already open instance in the left-hand tab group.

I opened a [discussion question in the microsoft/vscode-cpptools repo](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-cpptools/discussions/13867) asking if there was an option to change this behavior, and it was requested that I open an issue here as they say this behavior is due to the default behavior of the `window.showTextDocument` API when called with no options.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install the `ms-vscode.cpptools` extension
2. Create an `example.cpp` file
3. Create an `example.h` file
4. Dock the `example.h` file to the right of the `example.cpp` file
5. Add an `Example` class definition in the `example.h` file
6. Add a `void Testing();` method definition to the `Example` class
7. On the `Testing` method definition, select the `Create definition of 'Testing' in example.cpp` Quick Fix option
